items.title: Live: One person killed in Victorian bushfires, as 300 structures confirmed lost
items.description: Authorities are continuing to battle out-of-control bushfires across Victoria, which have already claimed dozens of properties. Meanwhile, extreme heatwave warnings remain in place for NSW, ACT and WA. Follow live.

items.title: 'Mate, let's go again': Firefighter continues shift after home burns
items.description: CFA volunteer Michael Harper discovers through the truck radio while on shift that his home is under threat.

items.title: Property saved with mops, mates and rakes after fire encircles home
items.description: Everywhere you look around the Irvines' farm near Alexandra are signs of the fire that surrounded their home and burnt right up to the front porch.

items.title: The ABC was allowed in to Afghanistan. This is what we saw
items.description: Four years after the Taliban's return to power, security is no longer the defining issue in Afghanistan. Instead, one of the world's worst humanitarian crises is exacerbated by a series of overlapping disasters.

items.title: Live: Nearly 22,000 homes without power after ex-Cyclone Koji crosses coast
items.description: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji makes landfall in north Queensland as a tropical low, bringing heavy rain and damaging winds. Follow live.

items.title: Has Trump landed a dud with his Venezuelan oil play?
items.description: While debate rages over the legality and the potential fallout from America's incursion, there's been a quiet acceptance that it is all about oil.

items.title: Christian sect investigated by the FBI under pressure to reveal wealth
items.description: Survivors of a secretive Christian sect, under investigation by the FBI, say it is hiding wealth through trusts, blocking access to abuse compensation.

items.title: Sydney daycare first to be shut by new regulator over safety breaches
items.description: Fun2Learn in Rosehill is the first centre to have its doors forcibly shut by the new child care regulator after it uncovered 41 breaches.

items.title: 'Only thing missing is my eight-year-old daughter': Father's chilling report
items.description: Fifty years after Beaumaris schoolgirl Eloise Worledge vanished, could new leads solve one of Australia's most haunting cold cases?

items.title: Thousands protest against ICE after fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good
items.description: The protests come after Renee Nicole Good was fatally shot by an immigration officer in Minneapolis.

items.title: Six dead, including child, in Mississippi shootings, suspect charged
items.description: A man is charged with murder after six people from the same family were killed in a series of shootings.

items.title: WA towns look to tackle overtourism as 'crazy' crowds pack car parks, beaches
items.description: As WA's tourist towns experience an influx of summer visitors, some locals are worried their hometowns could become too crowded unless visitor numbers are controlled.

items.title: Brawl contained, fireworks cancelled due to fire ban as Summernats ends
items.description: Australia's largest car festival draws to a close in Canberra, with record cars, championship wins, and a brawl that police are investigating.

items.title: Farm kids gifted champion's puppies to secure a skilled future
items.description: In small towns scattered around Australia, five kids have hit the jackpot. They've each been given a puppy from a champion muster dog.

items.title: People with lipoedema face healthcare barriers, forcing some to relocate
items.description: Women with lipoedema in the Northern Territory are struggling to access the care they need, forcing some to relocate for specialist treatment. The condition, often misunderstood, requires better medical support in regional Australia.

items.title: Mystery grips village after 'priceless' trophy fleeced from museum
items.description: For years, a prestigious trophy that represented Australia's ties to Italian high fashion took pride of place in a Tasmanian museum. But it is now missing after a 'targeted' overnight robbery.

items.title: Violence reported across Iran as government signals crackdown on protests
items.description: Anti-government chants filled the streets of Iran's capital on Saturday night, as protesters pressed the biggest movement against the Islamic republic's rulers in more than three years.

items.title: Grateful Dead founding member Bob Weir dies at 78
items.description: Bob Weir's death was announced on Saturday in a statement on his Instagram page.

items.title: 'Let them smoke and die': How Aussies reacted to smoking cancer link in 1964
items.description: How did Australians in 1964 react to a major scientific report showing the deadly dangers of cigarettes?

items.title: Challenges faced by police in hunt for alleged Mullewa gunman
items.description: A search and rescue specialist details the significant hurdles faced by police as the manhunt for an alleged gunman in Western Australia's Midwest enters its fifth day.

items.title: Sixth-tier minnow Macclesfield ends Crystal Palace's FA Cup defence
items.description: Non-league Macclesfield delivers one of the biggest upsets in FA Cup history by stunning defending champion Crystal Palace 2-1.

items.title: Being bored in the Perth suburbs inspired this Oscar-winning writer
items.description: Writer Shaun Tan highlighted the magic and whimsy of everyday Australia in his book Tales from Outer Suburbia. He talks about finding inspiration in the mundane, and what it was like turning his tales into TV.

items.title: Wetland teeming with life in this remote Corner Country of NSW
items.description: In a remote and isolated part of NSW, nature is enjoying a deluge of water still around from floods in Queensland last year.

items.title: 'Predator-free' fence project praised for restoring Kangaroo Island's native wildlife
items.description: Five years after feral cats were removed from inside the Western River Refuge on Kangaroo Island, populations of endangered species have boomed.

items.title: Khawaja stars as Heat thrash Thunder, Warner injured
items.description: Usman Khawaja's international career may be over, but he showed he is far from a spent force by stroking a fine 78 to help the Brisbane Heat to a BBL victory.
